bibliographic_metadata.Title: Recursive Annotation for Negative Labeling in Data-Driven Mineral Prospectivity Mapping
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Steven E. Zhang, Daniel Coutts, Mohammad Parsa, Renato Cumani, Aaron Thompson

abstract: Data engineering is a challenge in mineral prospectivity mapping using supervised data-driven methods due to a general paucity of true samples. This paper proposes a recursive annotation method based on positive and unlabeled learning to annotate negative samples, which improves model performance and spatial continuity of prospectivity maps. The method was applied to a graphite prospectivity map in Canada, demonstrating its effectiveness in enhancing mineral exploration.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT)
key_points: Proposes a recursive annotation method to improve negative sample labeling.
Demonstrates effectiveness in enhancing mineral prospectivity mapping.
Utilizes a deep ensemble approach for model performance assessment.
Focuses on graphite exploration in Canada as a case study.
Addresses challenges of data scarcity and label crossover in mineral prospectivity mapping.
